names.pinyin: zheng yin li lao tang jia wei
names.english: modified rescue yin manage exhaustion decoction
names.commonEnglish: Modified Rescue Yin Manage Exhaustion Decoction

actions: Tonifies Lung Qi, generates Body Fluids and stops thirst.
With Wu Wei Zi and Mai Men Dong, for Qi and Yin Deficiency with shortness of breath and spontaneous sweat (usually secondary to injury from Heat).
Moistens the Lungs, nourishes Yin and stops cough.
With Ren Shen and Wu Wei Zi, for profuse sweating, wheezing, increased Heart rate and exhaustion due to severe Deficiency of the Heart and Lungs.
With Sheng Di Huang, for hematemesis or epistaxis due to Yin Deficiency with Excess Heat.
Astringes leakage of Lung Qi, stops cough, tonifies Qi, tonifies the Kidneys, astringes sweat and generates fluids.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, stops cough and treats dyspnea.
With Bai Shao, regulates and harmonizes Qi and Blood for Blood Deficiency Heat.
With Bai Shao, for Blood Deficiency Heat.
Nourishes the Blood, astringes Yin, calms Liver Yang and Liver Wind and alleviates pain.
With Sheng Di Huang and E Jiao, for Internal Stirring of Liver Wind, as in the aftermath of a febrile disease.
Clears Heat, cools the Blood, nourishes Yin and generates fluids.
With E Jiao, for coughing, hematemesis, epistaxis, and uterine hemorrhage due to Heat from Deficiency.
Clears Heat, cools and harmonizes the Blood, clears Deficiency Fire, invigorates the Blood and dispels Blood Stasis.
With Sheng Di Huang, for Ying and Xue Stage Heat with epistaxis and hemoptysis and Kidney Yin Deficiency with steaming bones.
Strengthens the Spleen, resolves Dampness and clears Heat.
Tonifies the Spleen and Kidneys and astringes Jing.
Regulates and descends Qi, adjusts the Middle, relieves the diaphragm, dries Dampness and transforms Phlegm.
Astringes leakage of Blood, stops bleeding and tonifies Qi and Blood.
With E Jiao, for hemoptysis due to Lung Yin Deficiency.
Astringes the leakage of Blood, stops bleeding, nourishes the Lungs and resolves Phlegm.
With E Jiao, for hemoptysis due to Lung Yin Deficiency.
With Ce Bai Ye, for hematemesis.
Cools the Blood, stops bleeding, stops cough and asthma and expels Phlegm.
With Sheng Di Huang, for All types of bleeding due to Heat in the Blood.
With Bai Shao, for profuse menstrual bleeding.
Nourishes the Blood, stops bleeding, nourishes and moistens Yin and moistens the Lungs and Large Intestine.

Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moistens the Lungs, resolves Phlegm, stops cough, clears Heat, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
Tonifies Qi
Nourishes Yin
Clears Heat
Cools the Blood
Stops bleeding
syndromes: Lung and Kidney Qi and Yin Deficiency

symptoms: Chronic wheezing which is severe and may be constant
Wheezing may be worse at night
Wheezing and panting which is worse on exertion
The patient may develop a barrel chest and a thick neck
Tightness and fullness in the chest
Maybe superficial edema of limbs and body
Low back and knees sore and weak
Large, red skin reaction to needles or pressure
Maybe kyphosis of the upper back
Maybe pain in shin, foot, and heel
Patients who used steroids as children may be small in stature
manifestations.tongue: Red and dry or Pale, moist and swollen
manifestations.pulse: Thready and rapid, may be fuller if on steroids or Deep and thready or Weak

modifications.purpose: hemoptysis with afternoon or bone-steaming fever
